children.name: to prepare sth so that it is ready to be used
prepare
children.definition: to prepare sth such as aplace, amachine, or piece ofequipmentfor an event or activity that has been planned: chuẩn bị
examples: Before you start painting, prepare the walls by cleaning them and filling any cracks.
When they are not in the classroom, teachers spend much of their time preparing lessons.
prepare sth for sth
The Americans are preparing two new satellites for launch.
Maintenance staff are busy preparing the field for tomorrow’s big game.

children.name: get sth ready
children.definition: to make sure sth is ready to be used:
examples: ▪ I’ll get the car ready
get sth ready for
▪ Try to get all your things ready for school the night before.
▪ Her main job is to do general cleaning and get the rooms ready for guests.

children.name: set up
children.definition: to prepare theequipmentthat is needed for an activity, by putting them in the right places, putting different pieces together etc: chuẩn bị
examples: We’ve set up a microphone in the corner.
It was 6:30 and traders were already setting up their market stalls.
It’ll take a few minutes to set the camera up.

children.name: to prepare for sth that will happen in the future
prepare
children.definition: to make plans or arrangements for sth that will happen in the future, so that you will be ready when it happens: chuẩn bị
examples: I’ve been so busy that I’ve had no time to prepare.
prepare for
He only had a few hours to prepare for the interview.
People on the island are preparing for another storm.
prepare to do sth
The company is preparing to expand its European network.
preparatory[attri] done to prepare for sth
a series of preparatory meetings

children.name: get ready
children.definition: to do all the things you need to do to prepare for a specialoccasionorevent:chuẩn bị
examples: ▪ We’re looking forward to the trip, but there’s so much to do to get ready
get ready for
▪ We’ve spent the last few days getting ready for Christmas.
get ready to do sth
▪ It seems the whole country is getting ready to welcome the visiting president.

children.name: make preparations
children.definition: to do all the things you must do in order to prepare for an important event:chuẩn bị
examples: We set a date of January 8 and began to make preparations.
make preparations for
We started to make preparations for the wedding about a year ago
make your preparations
I made my preparations with great care.

children.name: in preparation for
children.definition: if you do sth in preparation for a planned event, you do sth to make it possible or more likely to be successful: để chuẩn bị cho
examples: Japan National Railways was split up in preparation for sale to private investors
In preparation for Passover, all ‘unclean’ items are removed from the house.

children.name: gear up
children.definition: if a company or organization gears up to do sth important or difficult, they prepare to do it by making changes, buying things that will be needed etc: “lên số” chuẩn bị sẵn sàng
examples: gear up for
The company will shortly be gearing up for a major expansion.
gear up to do sth
Retailers are already gearing up to meet the Christmas rush.

children.name: do the groundwork
children.definition: /do the spadeworkUK  to do the work that has to be done before sth else can happen:“tạo nền tảng,tạo cơ sở”
examples: All the necessary groundwork for the advertising campaign has already been done.
Although I did most of the spadework, I wasn’t given any credit for it.

children.name: mobilize
children.definition: /mobiliseUK  if a country or its army mobilizes, it prepares to fight a war: huy động, động viên (sẵn sàng chiến đấu)
examples: Britain mobilized its forces.
While the US mobilizes, top-level diplomats are making a last attempt to reach a negotiated settlement.

children.name: preparation
children.definition: /ˌprepəˈreɪʃən/  the time and work that is needed to prepare for something:
examples: thời gian chuẩn bị
▪ Months of preparation have gone into organizing the festival.
Hàng tháng chuẩn bi đã được thực hiện để tổ chức lẽ hội
▪ This dessert needs very little preparation, and you can serve it right away.
Món tráng miệng cần có thời gian để chuẩn bị và ban có thể phục vụ nó đúng cách
preparation for: sự chuẩn bị cho
▪ This is all part of the preparation for next month’s vital election.
Đây là thời gian chuẩn bị cho cuộc bầu chọn cấp thiết vào tháng tám
preparation of: thời gian cuhungr bị của
▪ Correct preparation of the canvas for painting is extremely important.
Thời gian chuẩn bị sơn dầu để vẽ là rất quan trọng
preparationnounGETTING READY sự chuẩn bị
[ U ] the things that you do or the time that you spend preparing for something
_The teacher didn't seem to havedonemuch preparationforthe class.
_The team blamed injuries and lack of preparation for their failure to win.
_Yasmin assistedin thepreparationofthis article.

children.name: preparations
children.definition: /ˌprepəˈreɪʃənz/ all the thingsyou have to do so that you will be ready for an important event:
examples: sự chuẩn bị, sửa soạn
▪ Despite their preparations, hospital officials worry that they could not cope with a major epidemic.
Mặc đu có sự chuẩn bị nhưng những viên chức bệnh viện lo ngại về việc họ không thể giải quyết được bệnh dịch
preparations for: sự chuẩn bị cho
▪ She’s busy with the final preparations for the wedding.
Cô ấy bận rộn với những chuẩn bị cho lễ cưới của mình
▪ Preparations for the conference are well under way.
Các sự chuẩn bị cho nghị đã được thực hiện tốt
preparations nhữngsửa soạn; chuẩn bị
plans or arrangements that you make to prepare for something
_[ + to infinitive ]We aremakingpreparationstofly Mr Goodall to the nearest hospital.
_Preparationsforthe opening ceremony are well under way.

children.name: to prepare sb for a job, activity, etc
train
children.definition: to preparesbfor a job, activity, or sporting event by teaching them the skills they need and encouraging them to practise:rèn luyện / huấn luyện
examples: ▪ The team is currently training in Hampshire.
train for
▪ She’s been training for the marathon for six months
train sb to do sth
▪ The staff must be trained to use the software correctly.
train sb for sth
▪ The troops had been trained for an important role in the battle.

children.name: prepare
children.definition: to prepare sb for sth that they will have to do, by providing them with the skills, training, or experience that they will need: chuẩn bị. trang bị
examples: ▪ The programs are aimed at preparing people who want to start up their own business.
prepare sb for sth
▪ Schools should do more to prepare children for the world of work.
▪ Nothing could have prepared him for what he saw during the war.

children.name: groom
children.definition: to carefully prepare sb for an important job or for a particular position in society by training them over a long period of time:chuẩn bị, huấn luyện
examples: groom sb as sth
Jiang was groomed as Deng’s replacement
groom sb to be sth
Mrs Adams had groomed her only daughter to be a perfect wife and mother.
groom sb for sth
Most people believe he is being groomed for the party leadership.

children.name: equip
children.definition: /ɪˈkwɪp/  to give someone the skills they need to deal with problems or difficult situations, especially by training them:trang bị
examples: equip sb to do sth
▪ A good education will equip your children to get a good job.
equip sb with sth
▪We do our best to equip refugees with the skills they need for survival in a foreign culture.

children.name: to prepare yourself for sth that you have to do
be prepared
children.definition: if you are prepared for sth unpleasant or difficult, you expect it and you have thought about it, so that you can deal with it more easily:
examples: ▪ The children were seasick last time, so this time we’re prepared
be prepared for
▪ I just wasn’t prepared for such a difficult interview.
be well prepared
▪ Clark’s lawyers were well prepared and confident.

children.name: prepare yourself
children.definition: to make yourself mentally and physically ready for sth that you will have to do: chuẩn bị bản thân, sửa soạn
examples: Before starting to write an answer in an exam, prepare yourself by thinking about what you want to say.
prepare yourself for
They prepared themselves for a long wait.
She has spent the last year preparing herself for the race.

children.name: get ready
children.definition: to do all the things you need to do in order to be ready to do sth, especially things such as washing or dressing before you go somewhere: sẵn sàng, sửa soạn
examples: You’d better go get ready - it’s almost 8 o'clock.
get ready to do sth
▪ I was just getting ready to go out when Tim called.
get yourself ready for sth
▪ In the stadium, the sprinters are getting themselves ready for the 100-metre race

children.name: brace yourself
children.definition: to prepare yourself for sth unpleasant that is about to happen: chuẩn bị bản thân
examples: ▪ Here comes the boss, and she’s not looking happy! You’d better brace yourself!
brace yourself for
▪ Socialist party leaders are bracing themselves for defeat.
brace yourself to do sth
▪ I didn’t really want to hear the rest, but I braced myself to listen.

children.name: steel yourself
children.definition: to prepare yourself to do sth that you know will be upsetting, frightening, or unpleasant:
examples: ▪ I had to steel myself before I could tell her about the accident.
steel yourself to do sth
▪ She steeled herself to look at the body again.
steel yourself for
▪ Jim steeled himself for a fight.

children.name: psych yourself up
children.definition: informal to prepare yourself mentally for sth difficult by making yourself believe that you can do it and that you really want to do it: chuẩn bị tâm lý, tinh thần
examples: I tried to psych myself up before the interview.
psych yourself up for
A lot of athletes use music to psych themselves up for a game.

children.name: work up to
children.definition: to prepare yourself to do sth that you do not want to do, by gradually making yourself more and more determined to do it: tập luyện
examples: I haven’t asked him yet, but I’m working up to it.
work up to doing sth
She’s been working up to telling her boyfriend it’s over.

children.name: gear yourself up
children.definition: especially UK to prepare yourself mentally for sth such as a test or important game, by gradually making yourself believe that you can do it successfully: “lên số, lên dây cót”
examples: The game’s on Friday, so we’re starting to gear ourselves up during training.
gear yourself up for
He’s been gearing himself up for his exams over the past few weeks.

children.name: to provide the necessary conditions for sth to happen
set the scene
children.definition: if an action or event sets the scene for another event, it provides the conditions in which that event can take place: chuẩn bị, “dựng cảnh”
examples: set the scene for
The negotiations in Geneva have set the scene for a possible agreement later in the year.
Recent events have set the scene for a potentially violent confrontation between the demonstrators and the army.

children.name: pave the way
children.definition: to provide the conditions that will make sth much easier to achieve in the future:mở đường cho
examples: pave the way for
These experiments may pave the way for a vaccine against some forms of cancer.
The Married Women’s Property Act paved the way for further legislation on women’s rights.
Scientists hope that data from the probe will pave the way for a more detailed exploration of Mars.

children.name: lay the foundations
children.definition: to provide the conditions that will make it possible for something successful to take place much later:đặt nền tảng, nền móng
examples: lay the foundations for
▪ Long-term planning after the war laid the foundations for the nation’s steady economic growth.
lay the foundations of
▪ The two sides met in an attempt to lay the foundations of a future peace settlement.

children.name: draw up
children.definition: drawsthupphrasal verbPREPARE chuẩn bị
examples: to prepare something, usually something official, in writing
_I've drawn up a list of candidates that I'd like to interview.

children.name: set
children.definition: verbsetting,set,setGET READY chuẩn bị
examples: [ T ] to get something ready so that it comes into operation or can be used
_[ + to infinitive ]The heating is settocome on at 5.00 p.m.
_Have you setupthe video recorder?
_I usually set my watchbythe time signal on the radio.
_He set the alarmfor7.00 a.m.
_Will you set the table (= put plates and utensils on it ready for use) , please?
